Instrument.name: Mars Global Surveyor Spacecraft Thermal Emission Spectrometer
Instrument.description: The Mars Global Surveyor Spacecraft (MGS) Thermal Emission Spectrometer (TES) measured the thermal infrared radiation emitted by the Martian surface, allowing scientists to identify minerals and study the planet's temperature, atmosphere, and surface features. TES helped to map the distribution of key minerals like basalt and clay, offering insights into Mars' past climate and geological history. It significantly contributed to understanding the planet's composition and the potential for past water activity.
